io.spine.io

Class Resource

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.spine.io.Resource

  • public final class Resource
extends java.lang.Object
    A resource file in the classpath.

    By default the resource will be loaded using the class loader of this class. In order to use another loader, please use file(String, ClassLoader).

    See Also:
    file(String, ClassLoader)

    • Method Detail

      • file

        public static Resource file(java.lang.String path,
                            java.lang.ClassLoader customLoader)
        Creates a new reference to a resource at the context of the given class.
        Parameters:
        path - the path to the resource file, relative to contextClass
        customLoader - the class relative to which the resource is referenced

      • exists

        public boolean exists()
        Checks if the resource with such a name exists in the classpath.
        Returns:
        true if the resource is present, false otherwise

      • locate

        public java.net.URL locate()
        Obtains a URL of the resolved resource.

        If the resource cannot be resolved (i.e. the file does not exist), throws an IllegalStateException.

        Returns:
        the resource URL

      • locateAll

        public com.google.common.collect.ImmutableList<java.net.URL> locateAll()
        Obtains all the resource files by this path.

        The order in which the URLs are obtained is not defined.

        If there are no such files, throws an IllegalStateException.

        Returns:
        the URLs to the resolved resource files

      • open

        public java.io.InputStream open()
        Obtains a new InputStream to the resource.

        The caller is responsible for closing the stream and handling I/O errors.

        Throws an IllegalStateException if the resource cannot be resolved.

        Returns:
        new InputStream

      • openAsText

        public java.io.Reader openAsText()
        Reads this resource as UTF-8 text.

        Behaves similarly to open() but works with a character stream, not with a byte stream.

        See Also:
        openAsText(Charset)

      • read

        public java.lang.String read()
                      throws java.io.IOException
        Loads the whole resource file as a UTF-8 text file.
        Returns:
        the content of the resource file
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - on a failure of opening the file, e.g. if the file does not exist
        java.io.IOException - on a failure of reading or closing the file

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
